is a 138 km hiking and pilgrimage route in the
that connecting many sites from the life and ministry of Jesus Christ. The trail begins in
, and passes through Sepphoris, Cana, the Horns of Hattin, the Arbel Cliffs, the Sea of Galilee, Capernaum, Tabgha, the Mount of Beatitudes, the Jordan River and Mount Tabor.

The Jesus Trail was founded by two young hikers, Maoz Inon and David Landis in 2007 however the actual marking of the trail was done in 2009.  It is currently managed and promoted largely by the volunteers, and is a non-profit project.
